qas.question: Portuguese law continues to be a major influence for what?
What is the Policia de Seguranca Publica - PSP (Public Security Police)?

answers.text: a civilian police force who work in urban areas

qas.question: What is the Policia Judiciaria - PJ (Judicial Police)?

answers.text: a highly specialized criminal investigation police

qas.question: Which entity oversees the Judicial Police?

context: Portuguese law applied in the <a0_0>former colonies and territories<a0_0/> and continues to be the major influence for those countries. Portugal's main police organizations are the Guarda Nacional Republicana – GNR (National Republican Guard), a gendarmerie; the Polícia de Segurança Pública – PSP (Public Security Police), <a1_0>a civilian police force who work in urban areas<a1_0/>; and the Polícia Judiciária – PJ (Judicial Police), <a2_0>a highly specialized criminal investigation police<a2_0/> that is overseen by <a3_0>the Public Ministry.
